snippet: The Federal Reserve chairman said the central bank was seeking greater clarity on the health of the recovery as it weighed the need for a new round of economic stimulus.
abstract: Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S Bernanke, tells the Senate Banking Committee that the central bank is seeking greater clarity about the health of the economic recovery, suggesting that officials are not ready to approve another round of stimulus; points to persistent, slow economic growth; Bernanke says that any new steps would be dependent on the pace of job growth in the coming months.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve chairman said the central bank was seeking greater clarity on the health of the recovery as it weighed the need for a new round of economic stimulus.

headline.seo: Bernanke Hints More Stimulus Is Unlikely Now
headline.main: Cautious on Growth, Bernanke Offers No Hint of New Action
headline.print_headline: For Now, the Fed Is Doubtful of More Stimulus
